title: The Question of Cotton in the Shroud of Turin’s Yarn
post:
Raes examined the so called “Raes Corner”; as the name suggests it’s a piece of textile even more external that this of the carbon dating;

So when Raes writes “main cloth” he means the border, an area that could have easily been manipulated.
Only in this area we have a verified presence of cotton inside the linen threads.
http://www.ohioshroudconference.com/a17.htm
Rogers writes:
“Cotton fibers are easy to find mixed intimately with the linen fibers of Part I Raes threads….I do not attempt to make a quantitative cotton comparison between Raes and radiocarbon threads and Shroud tapes, because there was too little cotton of any kind on Shroud samples. We had been puzzled by the Raes report at the time of the 1978 STURP observations in Turin. We could not find more than traces of cotton on the Shroud. The cloth appeared to be pure linen.”
(Rogers, “A Chemist’s Perspective On The Shroud of Turin”, p.66)
